discourse_list.title: Black Thursday Vault owners report Thread

content.content: This thread is for vault owners that want to come - or anyone really and pretty much make entries like Vault NNNNN - Comments  to present their Black Thursday loss post mortem event. This thread is simply about accumulating individual vault data so the full picture can emerge of the event and potentially a claims submission place for individual vault holders. I know that everyone at Maker wants to express sincere apologies for any misunderstandings as well as actual losses during this event, we feel your pain to the tune of ~80% of the total loss and want to do the best we can for the community as a community. With respect to being paid back - this is completely a Maker governance question (I this OP is but one small voice).  But if we can basically tally the cases and data here just as post mortem facts finding thread - particularly by the vault owners themselves I think it gives Maker governance a better look to make the best decision about whether and/or how much to compensate vault owners. So here you go felix - kick it off with Vault 2288 if you’d like or someone else pick a vault (how about the largest one) and give the full post mortem on it. It would be interesting alone to know how many vaults were affected by not just the 0 bid issue (which we have some data on thanks to: https://medium.com/@whiterabbit_hq/black-thursday-for-makerdao-8-32-million-was-liquidated-for-0-dai-36b83cac56b6 but other issues we don’t even know about yet like Vault 2288.

Posting as a gist because this website wouldn’t let me post multiple pics or images Full damage report below… this was majority of my savings. You will need to click the following gist link below.   gist.github.com   https://gist.github.com/OperationNine/cdae6635f14e89b16ae0632366d48770 Vault 2288 damage report as a result of 0 bid exploit.md Firstly - thank you for acknowleding my post.  Here is the link to my CDP Vault 2288:  https://defiexplore.com/cdp/2288  After seeing the 0 bid liquidations I realised I had to exit my CDP as the system was under failure.  The long story short is this. The events of the 0 bid liquidations caused me to have to ACT fast in order to avoid being liquidated to 0. I was even told in MakerDAO chat on the day as it was happening. "Do not get liquidated."   This file has been truncated. show original

I’m vault #6709 https://defiexplore.com/cdp/6709 I also got liquidated back in Dec where my vault had 700 ETH and I couldn’t repay mi debt due to lack of sai available and transactions not going trough. After that liquidation I was left with the 175 ETH that got put into this last vault. Now I’m at zero. I can’t find the old vault number since I migrated it to the new system. I already shared my thoughts on how this creates a big trust issue in all future users and what i believe should be done to remedy this: Compensating vault holders that liquidated at 0 bid?! Thanks for listening and creating a conversation about it.

First of all Thank you for dooing this. Vault 392  => https://defiexplore.com/cdp/392 During market crash i was trying pay back some DAI, all my tranzaction was failing becouse of network congestion.  My liquidation price was 124$, i had 109ETH in colleteral. i received 0 back. Please. As you can see i am with MakerDao almost from beginning, i was in zoom during MCD migration celebration ( i was the person who played rocky balboa song at background).  I am not a gambler, most of my loans are used for my small GPU-home mining business.   I keept eth for upcoming staking eth2.0 . some ETH wasn’t my own so now i’am in debt + becouse of cryptomarket have crashed my bussiness doesn’t give profit. I would apriciate if fair amount is payed out. Also becouse i am unemployed and bussiness going bad i can put my work to help with some tasks. ( Do meeting, presenting, give support, provide some computtion power) Thank you. [email protected]
Vault 4246. Been around for a second/had a SCD CDP in the triple digits. Got liquidated with around 1000 Eth Collateral, got 2.99 eth back.

Vault #3157: https://oasis.app/borrow/3157 I even bought 600 DAI with my fiat at the last moment to push down the liquidation price as you can see from the history. However, this was before the steeper drop that liquidated me as I fell asleep in my timezone. I woke up in horror to see my entire vault gone.
Vault 5931, got liquidated with 21 ETH collateral, got 0.88 ETH back.
Vault 3882. Got 118 eth colleteral. Get zero back. Tried to save cdp true the day but a person need to sleep and got liquidated while sleeping.
Vault #4763. Had 600-odd ETH as collateral and ended with zero balance.

Hi my Vault#6194 OK lets simple find the whole story, the question here is are you going to do any kind of pay back or not? Had 19 eth after liquidation all what is left is 1.6eth ? What is the  point of setting  Liquidation price if can’t be executed. My liquidation price was 130$ but it was sold on 95$?  After reading all those people who were left with nothing, i should think of myself as lucky one? Please reconsider some kind of payback if still care about your project.
Vault #2282. Had 168 ETH as collateral and ended with a zero balance. The defi explorer shows what happened during liquidation https://defiexplore.com/cdp/2282 which left me with nothing.

Vault #4006 here. Also got liquidated 100% for over 35ETH as can be seen here: https://defiexplore.com/cdp/4006 Curious what MakerDAO is intending to do for compensating the fact that all collateral is gone.

My Vault:  https://defiexplore.com/cdp/3805 Earlier that day i deposited 10 extra eth to bring down the liquidation price. Later that evening my cdp was completely liquidated leaving me with 0 eth. I had 52 eth in there. 32 was going to go towards staking. Im extremely disheartened by this whole thing, i have been trying to get my friends and colleagues to use mkr as it offers something which usually would take a lot of paperwork and time. When i saw my cdp at 0 i knew something was not right, i havent read the fine prints but i think its fair to presume most users would expect that when a liquidation occurs enough eth is sold to cover the debt and the rest is left in the cdp. Im sorry for the loss of all the vault owners including myself and hope that we are compensated for our loss. its only fair. thanks neece

Vault #3834. Lost 105 ETH, nothing left. Tried to repay 1200 DAI with Fiat to stabilize last minute, stayed up all night to monitor but fell asleep during a transaction that took forever and could have saved my savings. Woke up in shock to a liquidated CDP

Vault #2363 Collateral ~579 ETH  (not sure if it was exactly this) Liquidation price ~178$  (not sure if it was exactly this) ETH returned: 55ETH I SHOULD HAVE RECEIVED: on DefiSaver history, I calculated a minimum of 234ETH, but I’m not sure about the calculation because I don’t have a lot of details in the history. The bids were at 0$ or 120$/ETH (far from the 178$). I added more collateral the day before, and some at 1am, 3 hours before liquidation. It was not working when I wanted to “Repay” more than 5ETH on DefiSaver (I don’t remember the error), so I tried 5ETH and the transaction were very slow as you may know, and it was already too late. Vault #4996 Collateral 262 ETH Liquidation price 173$ ETH returned: 13ETH I SHOULD HAVE RECEIVED: a minimum of 63ETH –> At the time of liquidation, total ETH received back would have been minimum 297, which was ~50kUSD. But I received only 68ETH which was ~11kUSD.

@everyone who has been effected please fill in this sheet with your info and supporting evidence:   docs.google.com    MakerDAO CDP Liquidation Victims / Activists for Justice CDP Victim Report  Viral Campaign to find victims -  Post here after you have contacted someone. Check that their username isn't already logged here first.  (COPY/PASTE the message from the second tab. DIRECT MESSAGE ONLY) so we don't spam,Victims -...

I appreciate the effort here, but I think we’d prefer if liquidation data was scraped directly from the block-chain rather than self-reported. We’ll need to be able to verify everything, and taking the data from the chain will give us a complete list, whereas we may miss people if this is self-reported.
Yes, we need to have source code that produces the data.

Hey All Lucky Liquidator here of Vaults 6211    DeFi Explore    Defi Explore - MakerDAO MCD stats The easy way to check MakerDAO MCD positions and system stats.       5300    DeFi Explore    Defi Explore - MakerDAO MCD stats The easy way to check MakerDAO MCD positions and system stats.       5209    DeFi Explore    Defi Explore - MakerDAO MCD stats The easy way to check MakerDAO MCD positions and system stats.       I would like to also add that i have been a long time user of Marker DAO and a huge advocate of Defi but my confidence in Defi as a whole took a huge hit on that 12th March, i had been saving up this money which is most of my savings and i was in complete shock to see my Vaults go to zero like that. I know there are some good people in this community all i ask is that everyone who lost out to please be considered for compensation, many of us have worked really hard for this money and although yes we knew the risks i myself was always watching my CDP’s like a hawk and doing everything by the book to make sure i didn’t get liquidated.
So for now we don’t have to do anything?

I see that there hasn’t been a message here for 15 days. If you lost your Vault on Black Thursday, PLEASE comment on this thread: On-chain vault compensation poll, draft They are going to poll MKR holders with it, and your input is needed. If it’s worded too harshly against compensating, you will get NOTHING. So please PLEASE go take a look and make sure it is worded fairly.

I posted elsewhere on data finally appearing that should yield to complete Maker auction liquidation analysis.   Hopefully I will have a report for Black Thursday Vault owners that have reported here soon.     Compensating vault holders that liquidated at 0 bid?! Governance       Thanks to the data above from @Bobface of https://maker-auctions.io  and https://defiexplore.com/liquidations  I am able to do a full liquidation analysis spreadsheet on ETH from auction 1 to 4857 (BAT will follow as soon as I flesh out analysis structures within the ETH spreadsheet and then put the data together for a time sequence based analysis)).   I now have two different full data sets with all liquidation data as well as the subsection of this data analyzed by whiter4bbit to look at that …

Black Thursday victim here, Vault #6616. I had 99ETH as collateral during the crash - tried all day to add ETH (I had 100 more ETH in my Ledger Live wallet) but the transaction sat as “Pending” most of the day. There is no apparent way to add gas using my Nano X/ LedgerLive while using the Oasis App to increase the chances of the transaction going through. Very disappointed that I spent most of the day trying to add collateral to the contract, but the system was overloaded making it impossible. Here are my values on that day: 99 ETH as collateral - I generated 7,000 DAI on March 10th. With ETH value at $200.00 my Collateralization ratio was approx. 280%. On Black Thursday, I tried repeatedly to add ETH to the vault, but due to the falling ETH price, my transactions were stuck as “Pending” transactions and never completed. At today’s ETH price, I have a loss of 88 ETH ( -$14,960) plus the $7000.00 DAI = $7,960.00 LOST. My contract got liquidated and I ended up with only 11.22 ETH being sent back to my vault. My next challenge was withdrawing the 11 ETH, it took days of failed attempts to get the ETH back into my Ledger, and then finally it worked using the exact same procedure, almost as if a bug had been fixed(?) I would encourage the developers of Oasis to add a Gas Slider to the deposit window of the vault. Now that it’s over, I have learned that MetaMask allows for increasing the gas for a deposit, but there is no way to add gas using a Ledger Nano X. I also feel that there is more instructions needed in the Oasis GUI. How about some “?” bubbles that you can click to get more info? https://etherscan.io/address/0x10bbb2a8917a529028b10cf250af467d54c0d3df Thanks to anyone who can help with the loss, for me it is very real. - Earl

Vault holders.  You have not been forgotten. I finally completed a MCD Ethereum System Liquidation and a Black Thursday Compensation analysis Report available as a PDF in the following thread.     Maker MCD Ethereum System Liquidation report and Black Thursday Compensation Analysis Governance       Greetings Maker community,  At long last the Maker MCD Ethereum Liquidation and Black Thursday Compensation Analysis reports are availble below.    Lets keep discussion on the details of the report, questions, comments, etc. focused in this thread.  Stay tuned for updates on when a conference call on this report will occur.     Maker Governance has decided via on-chain poll its intention to compensate Black Thursday Vault owners but the details of compensation still being discussed. Thank you all for your patience on this.   Hopefully this process will complete and governance will ratify some kind of compensation package.   I know a number of you self liquidated (vault 2288) and have made reports here these all will be considered in due course as this process unfolds.

energyone:  99 ETH as collateral - I generated 7,000 DAI on March 10th. With ETH value at $200.00 my Collateralization ratio was approx. 280%. On Black Thursday, I tried repeatedly to add ETH to the vault, but due to the falling ETH price, my transactions were stuck as “Pending” transactions and never completed. At today’s ETH price, I have a loss of 88 ETH ( -$14,960) plus the $7000.00 DAI = $7,960.00 LOST.   How did you lose 7,000 Dai – this was value you generated against your vault and that you alone controlled? If you lost those funds, or spent them on whatever, that’s on you and has nothing to do with your vault, the Maker Protocol, MKR Holders or anyone else. Regardless of your (dubious) claim about using the vault, the statement trying to blame anyone but yourself for losing your 7,000 Dai is off the mark.

@Tosh9.0 - Sorry if I presented it in a confusing way- I am not saying that I lost the 7,000 DAI, but rather I was trying to show the DAI as a credit, not a debit. When I say “plus the $7,000 DAI” I am trying to show that the DAI was not lost. So, I lost 88 ETH thru liquidation ($17,336 at today’s price) but after taking into consideration the $7,000 DAI that was not lost, I have a loss of $17,336 minus $7,000 for a total loss of $10,336 at today’s price. I hope that is clearer than my first post. Thanks.

post moved to Maker MCD Ethereum System Liquidation report and Black Thursday Compensation Analysis

MakerMan:  2363 N/A 579 55 4996 N/A 232 13   Sorry, how my vaults can be N/A? They were liquidated during the night before Black Thursday. My Net Value was ~60KUS just before liquidation, and I got 68ETH in return, which was ~10k. So I got only 8% of my collateral back, it’s a bit far from the optimal number of 24.6%.
Hello, im looking for info on my vault #1000 I don’t see it on the list. Is there a link where I can view information on my vault specifically? https://defiexplore.com/cdp/1000

N/A just means they are not in the 0-bid liquidation set over the time chosen.   So you are not in the 0-bid compensation plan proper. I see you basically were liquidated when the Market price to OSM was larger than 20% and the market price was falling while your vault was being liquidated. I will make a note of you when discussing this as you will be one that fell outside the selected time range.   (i.e. there were no 0-bid auctions going on)   What I do see is that market prices at the time were already starting to fall.   Literally OSM was 171 and some markets were at like 135-140 which with the 13% liquidation fee pretty much put you in the no-collateral return level. The only way anyone gets even close to the theoretical collateral return of 24.67% is if the market is either going up after falling and triggering an auction or that the OSM is matching market.   At times the market is > 20% lower than the OSM auctions will be ‘normal’ and ‘efficient’ but simply not return collateral. Like I said I will note you in the list but can already anticipate governance here which will be a possible narrowing of compensation against a market performance filter vs. a tab based on like I chose and I will need a better dataset with prices and timings to even have a hope of applying such a filter. I was there watching these markets on these days (like I normally do) and we were seeing 10% or greater drops in minutes.   No way one could expect anything close to theoretical collateral return in such circumstances.  That is like expecting people to overpay for something from you when they can buy it cheaper elsewhere.   Due to the nature of the auction process it is possible for keepers to basically overbid and then be stuck with a loss on the collateral.   Which is EXACTLY what happened to many keepers during the time you were liquidated.   It is why I think you got some of your collateral back vs. getting none.

@sah I have vault 1000 in the Black Thursday compensation list. BTW:  It is easy for people to see if they are in this list.  Just look up your vault auctions on defisaver and see if your auctions were between auction 762 and 4325. example:  https://defiexplore.com/cdp/2363 ending up at one of his liquidations https://defiexplore.com/liquidation/ETH/724 which 724 being outside of the 762-4325 range.
Vault 4452, got liquidated with 480 ETH collateral, got 0 ETH back.

I’m not fully in the loop since the other topic, but my vault is 4056. I was travelling abroad, without a laptop, talking with a friend about our vaults. He topped up his the night before but couldn’t get it working on mine. Next day mine was empty, his wasn’t. I was quite depressed for a few days.
Vault 4514, got liquidated with 1360 ETH and 0 ETH back.
@make_dao_2020 The average vault collateral returned from liquidations before Black Thursday was 17.7% which would have given you 240.72 ETH back.
only 240.72 eth back？that’s unacceptable

I disagree. That’s a fair return based on the historic average. What is unacceptable is 0. And that its been 2 months with no compensation being put together. I would like to hope within the next 2-4 weeks we can move on from this all. We all need to do our part.
Thanks for the reply! But are you sure about the number of 17.7% (and 240.72 ETH)? It’s still not finalized, right?

@make_dao_2020 No polling or votes have been made so nothing is finalized. I’m just saying that 240.72 is 17.7% of 1360 and that is the average amount of collateral returned to vault holders prior 0 bid auctions happening

@pk7654   Vault 4056 liquidated in the Pre-AGC period. Also unless you or I made a mistake I have you with the following: 160ETH total			136.408255380826 Liquidated This returned 23.591ETH or  14.74% Auctions 4420 4578 4588 4590 The above vault is not included in the Black Thursday compensation report.
Vault 4514,  I have you already in the Black Thursday compensation class with 1360.00079ETH returning 0.

Where can I find more on what’s pre-AGC? I’m not sure if your statement is correct, my vault was empty when I checked it on the morning of March 13 (around 07:00) and still is. There’s no 23.591 ETH back anywhere as far as I know. When I check the actions, this one has 3 bids:  4420  And these have 1 bid:  4578 4588 4590  If I interpret the pages correctly, all auctions closed at a price of around 90 DAI/ETH which doesn’t seem like a 0 bid auction. But then again, where’s the remainder in ETH? And why does the vault overview page list everything twice? Is the different between the two what I should have received in the liquidation?

Well then the question is whether you are vault 4056 or whether you slipped a digit. If you want to look yourself…    DeFi Explore    Defi Explore - MakerDAO MCD stats The easy way to check MakerDAO MCD positions and system stats.      They were NOT 0-bid auctions and yes we can have a successful auction that returns 0 collateral and still pays the full tab. In the case of vault 4056 there was 23.591ETH returned as you can see for yourself on defiexplore.com link above. As always I understand this is difficult for everyone it is possible one or more mistakes can be made.   Please do read my Maker ETH Liquidation and Compensation report as the auction #'s 763-4324 (inclusive) are what is included in the Compensation Analysis.     Maker MCD Ethereum System Liquidation report and Black Thursday Compensation Analysis Governance       Greetings Maker community,  At long last the Maker MCD Ethereum Liquidation and Black Thursday Compensation Analysis reports are availble below.    Lets keep discussion on the details of the report, questions, comments, etc. focused in this thread.  Stay tuned for updates on when a conference call on this report will occur.     I encourage people to use defiexplore.com to look at the history of their vault. I am not sure what is up with the data here 4056.   In my data I show you should have gotten collateral back.  Defiexplore.come says same.   I look on https://oasis.app/borrow/4056?network=mainnet I see no collateral, and no withdrawal.   I agree with you something is not consistent with your 4056 vault and apologize if it seemed I was telling you something different than what you appear to be seeing.    We will have to look into this one a bit.    Technically though 4056 auctions fall outside of the Black Thursday compensation analysis though.   That was the main thing I was confirming. Take a look at what defiexplore.com and oasis is telling us on 4056.   I see that collateral should have been returned but I don’t see it. As to why you see things twice I think because you are seeing the tend and dent. From my dataset. 4420|50|3819.6750|4|42.3704840455724| |—|---|—|---| 4478|50|3819.6980|2|42.7444404918473| 4588|50|3819.6980|2|42.7444423695052| 4590|10|763.9390|2|8.54888847390104| 1st number auction, 2nd ETH lot offered, 3rd 1.13*tab to be covered, 4 bids, 5 amount of ETH sold There can be more bids both in tend and dent phases.   My data doesn’t discriminate between bids in tend or dent and just calls them all bids.   I am not sure how defiexplore.com is determining what is a bid or not.   I will have to ask my guy about how number of bids is determined to get a better idea.

I am 100% sure this is me and I did go through the auctions, for as far as I can understand them. After looking through your report again, time wise I’d say my auctions were in the BT fase, although they weren’t 0 bids.     MakerMan:  In the case of vault 4056 there was 23.591ETH returned as you can see for yourself on defiexplore.com link above.   I don’t see the 23.591 ETH anywhere on that page, could you point this out to me?     MakerMan:  I see no collateral, and no withdrawal. I agree with you something is not consistent with your 4056 vault and apologize if it seemed I was telling you something different than what you appear to be seeing. We will have to look into this one a bit. Technically though 4056 auctions fall outside of the Black Thursday compensation analysis though. That was the main thing I was confirming.   Thanks for confirming that something is amiss here and for looking into it further. I know the focus is for now the 0 bids, but this isn’t correct neither. Would this be part of the BT compensation analysis? Thanks for clearing up the double bids.

BT compensation analysis runs from auctions 763-4324 which is where the 0-bids happened.  Yours and at least one other fall outside of this group.   As to what happened you can see on defi-explorer the LOT offers and the tend reverse auction bids on the collateral and that is what you are seeing in defiexplore.com the lot offer 50, and the lot sale like 42.33 or whatever.   Which is what I see in my data and why I am confused I saw no ETH returned in that vault. If I can get anyone who has expertise to look into one or more of these auctions we will figure it out. My time is limited somewhat this week.

@bg1983  regarding vault 2724 and @pk7654  regarding vault 4056 After some investigation I am told your collateral is waiting for you to claim.What I am being told is that if you come back to oasis.app with the wallet for those vaults connected to your browser that you should see some sort of banner informing you that there is collateral to be claimed where you can then claim the returned funds from your liquidations. Please take a look again on oasis and see if you get some kind of banner message saying you have collateral to reclaim or not and let us know.  If anyone manages to get this to work please take a screenshot of what it looks like because I think there may be more vaults liquidated that got collateral back but have not claimed it.

It actually is! I reclaimed it and the ETH is now available in my vault again. The banner looks like this: image994×70 5.74 KB You need to confirm the txn in your wallet and in a few secs the ETH is back in your vault. Thanks for your work MakerMan!

@openforbusiness I see with with liquidation 4471 you got 12.7% collateral back.   Technically I have you just outside the current BT liquidation class (I picked auctions 763-4324). I will be providing another update this evening.   We are discussing how to approach setting the class in terms of time limits as I know out to auction 4700ish Maker was still getting impaired auction performance but ultimately the time frame and conditions for whether a vault meets a compensation standard will be determined by them.   a lot of auctions during your time frame (after 4324 and before say 4700) only netted 10-12% collateral return.   Some of the larger auctions 500ETH netted barely 2-3% for the vault holder.   There still seems to be some debate as to the reason.   whether this an auction time thing or size.   Your auction was rather small so it matched performance of other auctions of your size. Sad welcome to both you @openforbusiness and @Damas as first time posters.  Hopefully we will turn this rock soon here.
@Damas you are in the liquidation class as I have defined it by time and auction conditions formally.   So if anyone receives compensation you will.   How much that is a matter for governance.

Folks.   I want to urge again everyone asking. Use defiexplore in conjunction with the Liquidation and Compensation Report posted above to determine if ‘you might be in the class’. When I tell people they are in the class it just means they were one of the vaults that liquidated during the BT time frame chosen (auctions 763-4325).  Ultimately governance via on-chain poll will have to decide what qualifies a vault for possible compensation.   They may change the time frame or conditions to qualify.    The above was simply a report so governance could make these decisions and in the compensation report to attempt to quantify the possible cost involved for some basic scenarios. Example:    DeFi Explore    Defi Explore - MakerDAO MCD stats The easy way to check MakerDAO MCD positions and system stats.       with this auction https://defiexplore.com/liquidation/ETH/1700 is in the BT class as defined in the above report because auction 1700 falls between 763-4325.

@monet-supply - Please add vault 4844 (oasis). … as opposed to 4846 (oasis). I requested the Instadapp folks to investigate, see the following investigation thread for details. My liquidated vault is 4844 as a result.
